results.text: For we do not have a high priest who is unable to empathize with our weaknesses, but we have one who has been tempted in every way, just as we are—yet he did not sin.
results.reflection: Knowing that Jesus faced tests and overcame them gives us hope and strength in our own trials.

results.text: because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance.
results.reason: Addresses the idea of undergoing tests.
results.reflection: Through tests, our faith is strengthened, leading to perseverance.

results.text: so that the proven character of your faith—more valuable than gold, which perishes even though refined by fire—may result in praise, glory, and honor at the revelation of Jesus Christ.
results.reason: Highlights the refining process through tests.
results.reflection: Our faith, when tested and refined, brings praise and honor to Jesus Christ.

results.text: Test me, Lord, and try me, examine my heart and my mind;
results.reason: Asking God to test and examine.
results.reflection: Inviting God to test us and purify our hearts and minds.

results.text: The crucible for silver and the furnace for gold, but the Lord tests the heart.
results.reflection: God's tests are meant to refine and purify our innermost being.
